posts.post_content:
SlackWareWolf, they stopped reprinting the card itself since it was considered too powerful.  
But on the other hand they never stopped reprinting alternate versions of its effect:  
Some of them have a higher mana cost: [Elven Cache](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elven Cache) for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) was the first one, which thankfully was later replaced again by the cheaper [Recollect](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Recollect) for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol).  
Others came with certain restrictions: [Revive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Revive) for green cards, [Nature's Spiral](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nature's Spiral) for permanent cards.  
And there is also a creature with that cip/etb effect: [Eternal Witness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternal Witness), a 2/1 for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol).
posts.html:
SlackWareWolf, they stopped reprinting the card itself since it was considered too powerful.
But on the other hand they never stopped reprinting alternate versions of its effect:
Some of them have a higher mana cost: Elven Cache for was the first one, which thankfully was later replaced again by the cheaper Recollect for .
Others came with certain restrictions: Revive for green cards, Nature's Spiral for permanent cards.
And there is also a creature with that cip/etb effect: Eternal Witness, a 2/1 for .
